awards.title: Impenetrable
awards.intro: Extreme measures taken to harden the security of the total solution

awards.title: Use me
awards.intro: The solution with best overall user experience, both software and hardware

awards.title: Geek out!
awards.intro: The solution that incorporates the most geeky stuff in the most geeky way

awards.title: Money tree
awards.intro: The solution that has the best potential to make actual business

badges.title: [Description here]
badges.intro: Tell us what you are making! Sketch out what you are making.

criteria.text: Can include things like the concept, technology, sketches, blueprints etc.
This is the only badge you can prepare for in advance (we still want an awesome blog post).
No need to show us a finished product, but we would like a grasp and plan of what you are making, the underlying theme.

badges.title: AckWard
badges.intro: Using IoT for the most awkward things.

criteria.text: No need for this one to be useful, as long as it's aaaawkward
Toilet humor comes a long way on this badge...
#noshame #nofilter
Do you blush when writing this blog post? Then it’s probably AckWard worthy

badges.title: Attack of the drones
badges.intro: At least one drone doing something useful. Friendly drones!

criteria.text: It needs to fly in the air
Make sure to think of safety precautions
Safety first. Don't use it for something hazardous

badges.title: Babelfish
badges.intro: Utilize 5 programming/scripting languages or more

criteria.text: HTML and CSS does not count
Assembly does not count (it has it's own badge)

badges.title: Buttception
badges.intro: Create an awesome button with an awesome action!

criteria.text: The button must be PHYSICAL, not a digital one
Something has to happen when you click it

badges.title: Cloud city
badges.intro: Make good use of cloud services

criteria.text: It needs a reason to be in the cloud, don’t just put it there because we say so
Just a simple VM isn't really good use of the cloud

badges.title: C-C-C-Combobadge
badges.intro: Badge bingo-RAMA! Get given bingo on badge sheet and earn your Combobadge

criteria.text: Look at your badge sheet
The badges needed can be earned any given time during the event

badges.title: Dr. Who
badges.intro: Use IoT in a clever way which can help in medical purposes, assist in diagnostics or general health impovment

criteria.text: If you put the device on the body, it needs to be non-intrusive for the user

badges.title: Eyes wide shutter
badges.intro: Use cameras for something useful

criteria.text: And use the image output for something too
Respect others' privacy

badges.title: Force field
badges.intro: Adding proper security measures to your IoT solution

criteria.text: And not just security by obscurity

badges.title: First brunch
badges.intro: Sketch out the solution your team is making. The concept, the technology and more

criteria.text: Apply for a badge before lunch on the first day of the event
[Description here] does not count
You don't need to have the badge approved before lunch, but it has to be submitted in time. We can see timestamp!

badges.title: Foodie
badges.intro: Make smart use of IoT in cooking or something food or drink related

criteria.text: Bring out your inner food nerd and combine it with IoT
Cannot create food waste!
Show us your love for both food and IoT

badges.title: HUD
badges.intro: Create a dashboard that lets you make good decisions

criteria.text: A real dashboard, with useful informatio
Show off your data inn a nice and meaningful way
A dashboard contains more than one graph
Bring out your inner McGyver!
It must still work, but it can be dirty AF and show real bad craftmanship
Can be both hardware and software

badges.title: Instant
badges.intro: Whatever happens in one part of your solution should instantly have an effect somewhere else

criteria.text: More than submitting a form
Instant means within a second

badges.title: It's alive!
badges.intro: At least one land moving device that does something useful

criteria.text: It needs to move on the ground

badges.title: Leave no one behind
badges.intro: Go out of your way to help other teams in the event

criteria.text: Needs to be help with someone elses solution
The team that got help writes the blogpost as a thank you!

badges.title: Make love, not war
badges.intro: Code is free! Share it with the world and make your solution available online to the rest of the world

criteria.text: We want a good README!
It should be easy for the next person to clone and run it

badges.title: Metabadge
badges.intro: Get at least 10 cultural references in the other badges.

criteria.text: Come and tell us what kind of reference you have figured out (Each reference is 10p)

badges.title: Native
badges.intro: Create a native mobile app

criteria.text: ...and not just a website with icon shortcut
Make use of the native functions of the device

badges.title: Off the wire
badges.intro: Use four or more wireless transmission technologies in your solution

criteria.text: Examples: Wifi
Bluetooth
NFC
Z-wave/ZigBee
4G/LTE

badges.title: Race condition
badges.intro: At random, the jury will present a challenge. Timeboxed to one hour, the first team with a working solution gets all the points

criteria.text: The winner gets the GRAND SLAM 250 points
Second runner up gets 100 points
Third place gets those important 50 points

badges.title: Savvy
badges.intro: Show good craftmanship and create a sound and robust solution

criteria.text: Can be either software or hardware
Examples: consider GDPR, have unit tests on your code

badges.title: Shiny pixels
badges.intro: Make a beautiful application design

criteria.text: And we mean dashing, like if a real designer should have made it
On this badge, we prioritize graphic design over interaction design
Show us the grid and your spacing

badges.title: SmartCamp
badges.intro: Pimp your camp. Dress up. Bring some cool props.

criteria.text: We love a good theme in your team ;)

badges.title: Smooth object
badges.intro: Create a good design for a physical object that looks like a finished product

criteria.text: You don't need to have it physical in real life, a technical drawing or a rendering is OK
Have a clear description on what your product does
Dream big! You don't have to actual make the product you draw, but we would like to see how it would look like when it hits the stores

badges.title: Solder soldier
badges.intro: Parts of your solution needs soldering to be implemented

criteria.text: Your device needs to function afterwards...

badges.title: The analyst
badges.intro: Using big data to provide insightfull reports and drilling of your datasources

criteria.text: Use AI/ML to crunch your data to make useful insights
BYODS (Bring Your Own Data Sets)

badges.title: The assembler
badges.intro: Using Assembly in your solutions

criteria.text: The code must compile and run

badges.title: The presenter
badges.intro: One lightning talk by the team in front of everyone

criteria.text: Make it relevant for the rest of us
Only one member from the team needs to talk
Maximum 7 minute talk

badges.title: Three dimensions
badges.intro: Use a 3D printed object to enrich your solution

criteria.text: The printed item needs to be a useful function of your solutions
It is ok to use external 3D model libraries as a source for your 3D model

badges.title: This is intense!
badges.intro: Use 5 or more different sensors in your solution

criteria.text: Camera does not count here, as it has it's own badge

badges.title: Treehugger
badges.intro: We love nature. And so should you. Create a solution that is good for our enviroment

criteria.text: Be more like Greta. Save the world.

badges.title: Traveller
badges.intro: Create a transportation solution

criteria.text: It can be a part of a bigger scheme, a specific transportation solution, something that transports one thing from A to B etc.
Physical transport only, data traffic is not accepted

badges.title: T800
badges.intro: Include a robot in your solution

criteria.text: A drone, radio car nor plane is a robot (they have their own badges)
Must be a physical robot that works

badges.title: Under construction
badges.intro: Let's get physical! Construct and build an awesome physical object

criteria.text: Not enough with a 3D printed object, it has it's own badge

badges.title: Wear me!
badges.intro: Embedding IoT devices as a wearable device

criteria.text: We would love it if you made something else than a smart watch
Have your user in mind
